abstract: Peter J. Henning, a professor at Wayne State Law School who guest-blogs for the Deal Professor, thinks Bank of America may be able to present a defense of entrapment in lawsuits against it for not disclosing the large losses at Merrill Lynch sooner, since its chief executive says he was pressured by federal regulators not to do so.

lead_paragraph: Peter J. Henning, a professor at Wayne State Law School, occasionally writes as a guest blogger for the Deal Professor. Mr. Henning specializes in issues related to white-collar crime and is a former editor of the White Collar Crime Law Prof Blog.
